title: The best of The Telegraph in audio: The next PPI scandal and World Rugby's failure
text:
Every Friday the Telegraph will bring you a selection of our best articles, comment pieces and features in audio form to be listened to at your convenience.

Paul Hayward looks at the controversy surrounding the cancellation of matches at the Rugby World Cup due to Typhoon Hagibis.

Tom Rees and Lucy Burton explain why car financing loans could become the new PPI scandal.

The latest in our weekly 'How I made £1m' series focuses on David Sedman who shut down his family business to make his retro clothing shop succeed.

Macer Gifford analyses the impact of Donald Trump's contentious decision to remove US troops from the Syrian border.

Harry de Quetteville's in-depth report explains why we may be nearing the end of cash as the cost of circulating physical money becomes unsustainable.

Here are this week's recordings.

To listen, click the 'play' button of the recording you wish to listen to.

World Rugby have failed in their duty to complete the pool stage - this Rugby World Cup has been damaged
